If you’ve been looking to add more games to your backlog, grab a new console or pick up some accessories for your gaming PC, this year’s [Black Friday sales](https://www.engadget.com/deals/the-best-black-friday-deals-on-tech-for-2025-get-up-to-50-percent-off-gear-from-apple-amazon-disney-lego-dyson-and-others-230008015.html) look like a good opportunity to do so. To help you avoid wasting your cash, we’ve dug through reviews, [checked](https://keepa.com/#!) [price](https://www.dekudeals.com/) [histories](https://isthereanydeal.com/) and sorted out the best Black Friday gaming deals we could find below. So far we’re seeing PS5 consoles for $100 off, all-time lows for tons of [Nintendo Switch](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/nintendo/best-nintendo-switch-2-games-070007467.html), [PlayStation](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/playstation/best-ps5-games-144653195.html), [Xbox](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/xbox/best-xbox-games-140022399.html) and [PC games](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/pc/the-best-pc-games-150000910.html) and notable price drops on various [mice](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/pc/best-gaming-mouse-140004638.html), [keyboards](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/pc/best-gaming-keyboard-140019954.html), [headsets](https://www.engadget.com/audio/headphones/best-gaming-headset-130006477.html) and other peripherals we like.

## Black Friday gaming handheld deals

[**Steam Deck (256GB, LCD) for $319 at Steam ($80 off)**](https://store.steampowered.com/steamdeck): It’s nearly four years old, but the entry-level Steam Deck remains a [stellar value](https://www.engadget.com/steam-deck-lcd-review-2023-still-one-of-the-best-handheld-pcs-140044516.html) for playing PC games on the go. This 20 percent discount ties the best price we’ve seen. Just be aware that the Deck can struggle with some newer AAA games, while SteamOS continues to have compatibility issues with games like _Apex Legends_ or _Destiny 2_ that use kernel-level anti-cheat systems.
